page.title: 17LOCAL TRANSPORT CHANGES
page.content: The Hollinwood branch of the {Manchester and Ashton canal}is now disused. It has been cut off from the main canal but is a fishing ground and for recreational use. The humped back bridges are preserved and at Daisynook an aqueduct is incorporated into the country park. The canal is also remembered in the decoration of a new public house," The Streetbridge," built recently to replace an older pub of the same name. The{Droylsden railway station }is closed but the remains are visible. The branch line Southwards from here is closed, filled in and in many places its course is obliterated. The pub here is still called "The Railway" and has some railway memorabilia. Looking to the future, the route of the final link to the{M.O.R.R. (the {M66)}has recently been decided.
